themes.title: Fruits & Vegetables (F&V)
themes.description: A quiz game aiming To increase knowledge about the food groups of fruits and vegetables and educate/motivate users towards their optimal consumption pattern. Key educational themes for both food groups include representative foods, nutritional value, recommended consumption and portion sizes, ways to incorporate in diet, best handling/consumption practices, health effects, and the importance of variety and seasonality.

levels.title: Acquaintance
levels.description: To get familiar with the food groups of fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fruit?
Which of the following is included in the food group of fruits?
Which fruit do raisins come from?
Which of the following constitutes the best fruit choice among the different types of juice?
Which of the following is a vegetable, from a nutritional point of view?
Which of the following is a green leafy vegetable?
Which of the following is a root vegetable?
Which of the following is a starchy vegetable?

messages: Welcome to the world of fruits and vegetables!

The fruit group includes all fresh fruits (e.g. orange, apple, pear, banana, peach) and dried fruits (e.g. plums, raisins, apricots), as well as freshly squeezed fruit juices (i.e., 100% fruit juice without added sugars). Remember: packaged fruits juices with added sugar, soft drinks and other processed fruit drinks are not included in the food group of fruits.

The vegetable group includes all raw vegetables (e.g. lettuce, cabbage, carrot, tomato, cucumber) and cooked vegetables (e.g. broccoli, cauliflower, zucchini, beets). Remember: starchy vegetables, i.e. corn, peas and pumpkin, are also included in the vegetable food group, but they are rich in starch, a complex carbohydrate, which is not present in other vegetables.

There are different kinds of vegetables, like green leafy (e.g. spinach), root (e.g. carrot) or cruciferous (e.g. broccoli, cauliflower). Starchy vegetables, i.e. corn, peas and pumpkin, are also included in the vegetable food group, but they are rich in starch, a type of carbohydrate that is not present in other vegetables.

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar with the nutritional value of fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: Which is the main nutrient fruits consist of?
Which of the following nutrients is not included in fruits and vegetables?
Which of the following is a good source of fibres, which help the gut work properly?
Which of the following is true for the whole fruits as compared to fruit juices?
How can fruits and vegetables help you stay hydrated?

answers.text: They have a high content of water

questions.question: Which vitamin is most commonly found in citrus fruits (e.g. orange) and helps boost the immune system?
Which vitamin, found in green leafy vegetables, is essential for blood?
Which vitamin, found in fruits and vegetables, is important for the blood and the nervous system?
Which mineral, found in fruits and vegetables, helps keep muscles and nerves working properly?

messages: Fruits and vegetables are a very good source of a wide range of important nutrients!
They are primarily made up from carbohydrates which are mainly present in the form of sugars and provide energy to the body.
They also include vitamins (e.g. vitamin C, vitamin K, folic acid), minerals (e.g. potassium, calcium), fibres and also other compounds important for the optimal function of the body.
Even though they are solid foods, they contain lots of water and can also contribute to the body’s hydration.

levels.title: Recommended intake
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake and portion size of fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: What is the recommended intake of fruits?
What is one serving of fruit?
What is one serving of fruit?
What is the recommended intake of vegetables?
What is one serving of vegetables?
What is one serving of vegetables?
How many servings of fruits and vegetables should one eat every day?

messages: The recommended consumption of fruits is 2-3 servings per day. One serving is equivalent to 120-200 grams of fruit (e.g. 1 medium apple/ orange/ peach, or 2 small mandarins/ kiwis, or ~1 cup of strawberries/ cherries/ berries/ grapes, or ~1 cup of sliced watermelon/ melon, or 30g dried fruits, or 1/2 cup of fresh juice).

The recommended consumption of vegetables is 2-4 servings per day. One serving is equivalent to 150-200 grams of raw or cooked vegetables (e.g. 1 cup of chopped raw or cooked vegetables, or 2 cups of raw leafy greens like lettuce, or 2 medium carrots, or 1 large tomato).
Remember, 5-a-day is the way to go! Aim to consume at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables per day.

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with best practices to handle and consume fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to incorporate fruits in your diet?
Which of the following is a good way to incorporate vegetables in your diet?
Which is the healthiest way to cook vegetables to preserve most of their nutrients?
Compared to raw vegetables, cooked ones:
Compared to cooked vegetables, raw ones:
Washing fruits and vegetables before eating, make them:

answers.text: With less pesticides (chemicals used in the farm to protect the plants)

questions.question: Eating fruits and vegetables with their skin if edible, gives your body:

messages: There are so many ways to incorporate fruits in your diet! To name a few, consume them as snacks throughout the day (choose fruits that are easy to carry and peel for a healthy snack at school), use them to make nutritious desserts (e.g. fruit salad), or squeeze/grind them to enjoy refreshing fresh juices or smoothies.

Give priority to whole fruits (instead of fruit juices), and try to eat them with their skin (if edible) after thorough washing, to get advantage of all their nutrients (vitamins, minerals and fibres).

Enjoy vegetables in every occasion! Always accompany your main meals (lunch and dinner) with side salad or add vegetables in other foods/dishes (e.g. sandwiches, pasta, rice, soups or meat-based dishes) to make them more colourful and tastier.

Aim to eat most of your vegetables raw, as cooking can cause the loss of some important vitamins. Also, try to consume vegetables with their skin, as they contain extra nutrients; just make sure to wash them thoroughly beforehand to remove any dirt, pesticides or germs.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: To get familiar with the health benefits of fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: Eating fruits and vegetables every day is recommended for:
Fibres, found in fruits and vegetables, mainly help:
How do fruits and vegetables help reduce the risk of getting sick?

answers.text: They boost your body’s defence system
They keep you awake all the time
They give you extra energy for exercises

questions.question: Eating a variety of fruits and vegetables can benefit:

messages: Go healthy with more fruits and vegetables!
Fruits and vegetables are a key component of a healthy diet.
Among their numerous health benefits, they support optimal growth and development, boost our defence system, and help the heart and gut work properly.

levels.title: Variety and seasonality
levels.description: To get familiar with the concepts of variety and seasonality of fruits and vegetables.

questions.question: The colour of fruits and vegetables depends on?
Which of the compounds below give fruits and vegetables their particular colour?:
Why is it better to eat seasonal fruits and vegetables?
Eating seasonal fruits and vegetables helps:
A vegetable that is available for sale out of season:
Seasonal fruit and vegetable cultures:
Seasonal produce reduces food waste by:

messages: By incorporating a variety of colourful fruits and vegetables into your diet, and opting for seasonal produce whenever possible, you will not only boost your overall health and growth but also help protect the environment.
Eating seasonally also gives you the chance to enjoy food at its freshest, most flavourful, and most nutrient-dense form.
This approach helps you adopt a healthy, sustainable, and eco-friendly diet!

themes.title: Dairy Products (DP) Quiz
themes.description: To Increase your knowledge about dairy products!. Answer the questions and learn what counts as a dairy products from a nutritional point of view, their nutritional value , how much is recommended to consume and practical tips to meet your daily needs and handle them safely.

levels.title: Representative foods
levels.description: Familiarisation with the food group of dairy products.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dairy product?
Which of the following is a dairy product?
Which of the following is a dairy product from a nutritional point of view?
Which of the following is not a dairy product from a nutritional point of view?
Which ingredient have all dairy products in common?
Which of the following dairy products contains useful germs?

messages: Welcome to the world of dairy products!

From a nutritional point of view, the food group of dairy products includes foods made from milk which also contain similar amounts of some nutrients, like proteins and calcium. So, milk, plain yogurt, and cheese belong to this group, while butter, even though coming from milk, belongs to the fats and oils food group
Remember, yogurt desserts look like yogurt but contain added sugar and preservatives, so they are more like a dessert..

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar with the nutritional value of dairy.

questions.question: What is the main macronutrient in milk that helps your muscles?
Proteins contained in dairy products:
Which of the following products often include added sugars?
Whole-fat and skim milks differ in their:
What does 'low-fat' dairy products mean?
What do the lipids found in dairy products help your body do?
Which mineral found in dairy products helps you build strong bones and teeth?
Do low-fat dairy products contain enough calcium and proteins?

answers.text: Yes, if they are not cooked.

questions.question: Which of the following nutrients is not usually found in milk and dairy products?
Which of the following is true for calcium in cheese?

answers.text: The more yellow the cheese the more calcium it contains.
The whiter the cheese the more calcium it contains.
All kinds of cheese contain the same amount of calcium.

questions.question: The term fermented means that a dairy product:

answers.text: Has been produced in a farm.
Contains useful germs for our health.

messages: Dairy products provide high-quality proteins, which among many roles they help build and repait muscles .
They are also among the richest sources of calcium in the diet, needed for bones and teethes.
Dairy products also contain other important micronutrients vitamins like vitamin D, B12, and B2, and minerals such as phosphorus and potassium, that contribute to overall health.
Some dairy products, like yogurt, are produced with the addition to milk of some kinds of germs that they produce useful compounds healthy for your gut. These products are called fermented.

levels.title: Recommended consumption & portion sizes
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake and portion size of dairy products.

questions.question: What is the recommended daily intake of dairy products in children?
Which of the following counts as 1 serving of dairy products?
If you drink a glass of milk with breakfast, how many more servings of dairy do you need that day?
What else can you eat to get similar amount of calcium with that of 1 glass of milk?
What kind of milk should children over 2 years old drink?
What should you check on a yogurt label to find a healthier option?
Can children consume full-fat dairy products like whole milk and regular cheese?

answers.text: No, they are for adults only.
Yes, they can be part of a healthy diet.
Only if they don't eat vegetables.

questions.question: At what age could children start drinking low-fat milk?

messages: You should consume milk and dairy products daily as part of a balanced diet, aiming for 3–4 servings of dairy each day. One serving can be 1 cup of milk, 1 cup of yogurt, or 1 slice (30 grams) of cheese.
If you don’t drink milk, you can still get most of its nutrients from foods like cheese or yogurt
It’s also smart to check yogurt labels for added sugar to make healthier choices.
For children over 2 years old, both full-fat and (low-fat) milk and yogurts are suitable choices, depending on energy needs and overall health.
Have in mind that some people many have digestive problems when drinking milk. For them, there is a type of milk in the market called “lactose-free”.

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with best practices to integrate dairy foods into meals, snacks and recipes.

questions.question: What's a healthy way to add dairy foods to your breakfast?

answers.text: A bowl of whole-grain cereal with milk.
A cookie with chocolate and milk.

questions.question: What's a good choice to add dairy products to your lunchbox?
What's a fun, healthy way to enjoy dairy in a snack?

answers.text: A smoothie made with yogurt and fruit.
A chocolate milkshake with whipped cream.

questions.question: What could you add to mashed potatoes to increase the calcium content?
What can you use instead of sour cream to make a recipe healthier but still creamy?
What is a healthy topping for fruit salad to add calcium and protein?
If you want more calcium but don't like drinking milk, what can you try?

answers.text: Add whipped cream to your fruits.
Add grated cheese in your meals.

messages: A healthy way to enjoy dairy foods is by adding them to your meals and snacks throughout the day. You can start your morning with a bowl of whole-grain cereal and milk, or include a cheese stick or yogurt cup in your lunchbox. For snacks, a fun and nutritious choice is a smoothie made with yogurt and fruits.

To boost the nutrient content of recipes, try using milk or plain yogurt in mashed potatoes, or plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. If you're making a fruit salad, plain yogurt is a great topping that adds calcium and protein.
If you don’t like drinking milk, you can still get calcium by eating cheese, yogurt, or smoothies made with dairy products.

levels.title: Handling & storage practices
levels.description: To get familiar with safe storage, prevention and contamination, and understanding expiration dates and signs of spoilage of dairy foods.

questions.question: Where should you store dairy foods at home?

answers.text: In the fridge at 4 degrees Celsius (40 degrees Fahrenheit).

questions.question: Why is it important to keep dairy products cold?
'Expiration date' refers to the date a dairy product:

answers.text: Should be returned to the market.

questions.question: What's the best way to check if a dairy product is still edible?

answers.text: Smell it, check the texture, and read the date.

messages: To keep dairy products safe and fresh, they should always be stored in the fridge at least in 40°F (4°C). Low temperatures prevent harmful bacteria from growing, which can make you sick.
Always check the “expiration” date on the label. This tells you the latest date to use the product for the best quality and safety.
To ckeck if dairy product is still good, you should smell it, check the texture, and read the date. If it smells sour, looks strange, or is past its date, it’s best not to eat or drink it.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: To get familiar with the health benefits of dairy products.

questions.question: What part of the body needs calcium from dairy products to stay healthy?
Why are proteins in dairy products especially important for kids and teens?

answers.text: They help them build muscles and support growth.

questions.question: Besides bone strength, what is another benefit of eating dairy products regularly?
Fermented dairy products like plain yogurt and kefir:

messages: Dairy products are important because they help your body to grow strong and stay healthy.
The calcium in dairy products builds strong bones and teeth, while proteins support muscle development and growth.
Experts recommend dairy foods not just for growing up strong, but also because they help disease prevention, such as weak bomes when later in life.
Choosing low-fat or fermented dairy products can protect you from various health problems.

themes.title: Grains and Grain Products (G&GP) Quiz
themes.description: Increase your knowledge about grains and grain products! Answer the questions and learn which foods are included, their nutritional value, recommendations for consuming them and choosing their healthier forms.

levels.title: Acquaintance
levels.description: To get familiar with the food group of grains.

questions.question: Which of the following is a cereal grain?
Which of the following is not a grain?
Which of the following is included in the food group of cereal grains?
Which of the following is commonly used to make bread?
Which of the following foods are made from wheat?
Which of the following is not made from cereal grains?
Which of the following is a whole grain product?
Which of the following belongs to the food group of cereal grains?

messages: Welcome to the world of grains and grain products! The group includes products made from plants like wheat, rice, oats, barley etc. These grains are widely used to make products like bread, pasta, breakfast cereals, tortillas and crackers.
There are also other less known grains such as millet, buckwheat, and- quinoa,which are considered very healthy.
Grains are an essential part of a balanced diet and are available in many forms, which differ in their nutritional value. Learning about grains them helps you make healthier choices!!

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar with the nutritional value of grains.

questions.question: What is the main macronutrient in grains and their products?
Grains are low in:
Which of the following is part of a whole grain:

answers.text: The (outer part of the seed (called bran).

questions.question: What does the term refined mean for the grains?

answers.text: They have some parts of the whole grain removed.

questions.question: What makes whole grains different from refined grains?

answers.text: They contain all parts of the grain.

questions.question: Whole grains are a good source of:
Which of the following is lower in refined grains compared to whole ones?
The term 'enriched grains' means that in these grains:

answers.text: The vitamins that were removed with refinement have been added back.

questions.question: The term multigrain on a food label means that the product is:

answers.text: Made from more than one type of grains.

messages: Grains may be found as whole grains or refined grains They differ on the parts they contain. Whole grains have the original grain intact (whole), while the refined ones have lost some parts after processing (refinement). While both provide carbohydrates, whole grains also contain fibres, vitamins and minerals that have been lost through refinement.

levels.title: Recommended intake
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake and portion size of grains.

questions.question: What is the recommended intake of grains for children 9-13 y?
What is the recommended intake of grains for adolescents 14-18 y?

answers.text: Adolescents do not need grain intake.

questions.question: What is one serving of grain products?

answers.text: 1/2 cup of cooked rice or pasta (80g).

questions.question: What of the following is one serving of grains?
Which of the following is a healthier grain choice?
Which of the following is not one portion of whole grains?
According to recommendations whole grains should cover:

answers.text: At least 1/2 of your daily grains.

questions.question: Can children consume refined grains?

answers.text: Yes, they can be part of a healthy diet.
No, they should only consume whole grains.
Only if they are from wheat.

messages: The recommended consumption of grains varies depending on age and sex. Children 9-13 y can consume 5-9 servings per day and adolescents 14-18 y 6-10 servings depending on their daily energy needs.
One serving is equivalent to 1 slice of bread (30g) or 2 crackers or ½ cup (70-90g) of cooked pasta or rice or ½ cup (30g) of breakfast cereals.

Grains are divided into refined and whole grains. At least half of daily grain intake should come from whole grains. This means choosing whole wheat bread, brown rice, or whole grain cereals over refined options.

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with the best practices to prepare and consume grains.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to incorporate grains in your diet?
Which of the following is a good way to enjoy grains in your diet?
What is a healthy way to add grains to your breakfast?

answers.text: A bowl of whole grain-cereals with milk.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good grain choice for your main meal lunch?
Which of the following is a healthy grain choice to include in a snack?
Which of the following would you choose as a healthier grain-based sweet?
Compared to refined, whole-grain breakfast cereals often contain:
Reading food labels of grain products helps you:

messages: There are so many ways to incorporate grains in your diet!
Consume grain products as snacks (choose a toast with whole grain bread and cheese or crackers with egg for a healthy snack at school), and add them to your main meals.

Give priority to whole grains (instead of refined) to get advantage of all their nutrients (fibres, vitamins and minerals). Whole grain bread, oatmeal and brown rice are great whole grain options.Prepare them in simple ways, avoiding to add too much fat, sugar, or salt.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: T o get familiar with the health effects of grains.

questions.question: Eating grains every day is recommended for:
Fibres, found in grains, mainly help:
Eating whole grains fuels your body with minerals that help you with:
Grain products are rich in vitamins(B group) that help:

answers.text: Getting the energy stored in foods.

questions.question: How do whole grains protect your health?

answers.text: They help you keep a healthy weight.
They keep you awake all the time.
They give you plenty of carbohydrates and protein.

questions.question: Eating whole grains regularly can benefit:
Which nutrient, found in grains, is important for proper gut function?

messages: Eating grains, especially whole grains,keeps yout body healthy.
The nutrients contained in grains, fibres and micronutrients (such as B vitamins, iron, magnesium), play a vital role for many functions of your body.
Whole grain products contain more of these beneficial nutrients compared to refined grains, so they are even better for your health.

levels.title: Types and processing
levels.description: To get familiar with the concepts of types and processing of grains.

questions.question: Refined grains, compared to whole grains, have: :
Milling (= refinement) is a process that:

answers.text: Removes much of the grain's fibres and vitamins.

questions.question: Enriched grains are:

answers.text: Refined grains with added vitamins back.

questions.question: Which of the following is often highly processed?
Breakfast cereals often contain:
Minimally processed grains:
Which phrase should you look for on a label to confirm that a food is whole grain?

messages: Refined grains have been milled, that means that they have been processed to remove some parts of the original grain. This process aims at giving grains a finer texture and improving their shelf life. Unfortunately, it also removes a lot of beneficial nutrients.
Refined grains are often enriched. This means adding back certain B vitamins and iron that were lost during food processing. However, they remain poor sources of fibres.
Choose minimally processed, low-sugar and low-salt grain products when possible. For packaged products, read the labels for whole grain options to get the most from what you eat!!

themes.title: High-Protein Foods (HPF) Quiz
themes.description: Increase your knowledge about high-protein foods, other than dairy products! Answer the questions and learn about the different food categories included, how to make the best choices and how much you should eat to grow strong and healthy effects. .

levels.title: Acquaintance
levels.description: To get familiar with high-protein foods.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in the group of high-protein foods?
Which of the following is a high-protein food?
Which of the following is a high-protein food?
Which of the following is an animal-based high-protein food?
Which of the following is an animal-based high-protein food?
Which of the following is a processed animal-based high-protein food?
What are legumes?

answers.text: A type of cured red meat.

questions.question: What are pulses?

answers.text: Plant seeds used for making oil.
The non-edible outer part of legumes.
The dry edible seeds of legume pods.

questions.question: Which of the following is a legume?
Which of the following is a pulse?
Which of the following is a plant-based high-protein food?
Which of the following is a plant-based high-protein food?
Which of the following plant-based high-protein foods is made from soybeans?

messages: Welcome to the world of high-protein foods! Contrary to the other food groups you met since now, this is a diverse group of foods, containing both animal and plant foods. Nevertheless, their high content in proteins is what finally groups them together.
Animal-based high-protein foods include all kinds of meat (red or white) ,fish and seafood as well as eggs.
Processed meat products (e.g. sausage, ham, salami, peperoni ) although produced from red/white meats, and they usually contain many additives and preservatives that lower thein nutritional value.

Plant-based high-protein include pulses, which are the dry edible seeds inside of the legume pods, i.e. dry beans , dry peas lentils and chickpeas, as well as soybeans and their products (e.g. tofu, a product that looks like white cheese).
Remember: Dairy products, presented in a previous thematic area, are also considered high-protein foods but they make their own group, considering their content in calcium.

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar with the nutritional value of high-protein foods.

questions.question: Which is the main nutrient high-protein foods consist of?
What is an amino acid?

answers.text: A fatty acid found in meats.

questions.question: Which part of the egg is rich in proteins?
Besides proteins, which of the following nutrients do meats contain?
Besides proteins, which of the following nutrients do fish/seafood contain?
Which of the following nutrients is included in plant-based high-protein foods?
Which of the following high-protein foods is also a good source of fibres?
From which of the following high-protein foods is iron better absorbed?
Which of the following that are contained in processed meat products is harmful for your health?

messages: High-protein foods are a key part of a healthy diet! The key nutrient of this food group is proteins, which are used to build and preserve all of the body’s tissues.
Animal proteins are complete, meaning that they contain all the amino acids that the body needs. Plant proteins are not that complete, so they must be combined with other protein sources.

High-protein foods also contain other important nutrients! They are a good source of minerals, such as iron, zinc and phosphorus. Remember: iron found in animal-based high-protein foods, especially meats, is better absorbed by the body than iron found in high-protein foods of plant origin.

Red/white meats also contain saturated lipids, which should be consumed in moderation, while fish (especially salmon, sardines, herring and mackerel) and seafood are rich in omega-3 polyunsaturated lipids, which are beneficial for the heart and vessels.
Plant-based high-protein foods are low in lipids and very rich in fibres.

Remember: sausages, cold cuts and canned meats are processed high-protein foods, which are usually very rich in saturated lipids and salt and may also contain various chemical additives and preservatives.

levels.title: Recommended intake
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake and portion size of high-protein foods.

questions.question: What is the recommended frequency of red and white meat consumption?
What is the recommended frequency of fish and seafood consumption?
How often should one eat fatty/oily fish, which are especially rich in unsaturated lipids?
What is the recommended frequency of pulse consumption?
How much of your plate should be covered by high-protein foods in main meals (lunch and dinner)?
Which of the following high-protein foods should be avoided, because they are processed?

messages: Make high-protein foods a regular part of your diet!

High-protein foods can be consumed every day but should be rotated throughout the week to ensure variety. Aim for white and/or red meat 2-3 times per week, fish/seafood 2-3 times per week, and pulses at least once per week.
Eggs are also valuable sources of high-quality proteins that can accompany dishes based on vegetables, pasta or other grain products that are not high in proteins.

The exact amount of proteins you need depends on your age and body weight. A practrical way to meet your needs is to ensure that high-protein foods cover about ¼ of your plate in lunch and dinner.Do not forget that dairy products also contain proteins, so aim to consume 2-3 servings in breakfast and snacks!
Remember: try to avoid processed meats, such as sausages and cold cuts, as much as you can!

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with the best practices to handle and consume high-protein foods.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to incorporate pulses in your diet?

answers.text: As a meat substitute, e.g. in burgers and meatballs.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to incorporate eggs in your diet?

answers.text: In sandwiches/wraps instead of cold cuts.

questions.question: Which is the healthiest way to cook meat and fish/seafood?
Why is it important to adequately cook poultry?
When chicken is fully cooked and safe to eat, what colour should it be inside?
To avoid eating too many lipids when eating red meat, you should:
To avoid eating too many lipids when eating poultry, you should:

messages: To get the necessary proteins and avoid large amounts of saturated lipids: eat poultry without their skin, remove visible fat from red meat (usually the outer layer).
Eggs are a very nutritious choice for a high-protein snack (e.g. boiled egg), instead of for cold cuts in sandwiches/wraps, or even a main meal (e.g. baked omelette with cheese and vegetables).
To keep your meals as healthy as possible, choose animal-based high-protein foods that are boiled or roasted in the oven, and avoid of fried or grilled, especially barbecued

There are so many ways to incorporate pulses in your diet! To name a few, you can have them as a main meal (e.g. lentil soup), incorporate them in salads, use them to make vegetarian burgers or even enjoy them as spreads like hummus.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: To get Familiar with the health effects of high-protein foods.

questions.question: What is the main role of proteins?

answers.text: They help the body grow and stay strong.
They are the body’s main energy fuel.

questions.question: Proteins, found in high-protein foods, can:

answers.text: Help the immune system work properly.

questions.question: Except from muscles, high-protein foods are important for:
Not eating enough animal-based high-protein foods can increase the risk of:
A high consumption of processed meat products is particularly detrimental for:

messages: High-protein foods are an essential part of a balanced diet!

Did you know that all parts of your body , such as the heart, the lungs, the bones, the muscles and the skin, are made up from proteins? Proteins play a key role in building, maintaining and repairing the body’s tissues.
High-protein foods also help your body fight off germs , which prevents you from getting sick.
Keep in mind, though, that overeating high-protein foods, especially red meat and meat products, is bad for your health.

themes.title: Fats & Oils (F&O) Quiz
themes.description: Increase your knowledge about fats and oils! Answer the questions and will learn about the kind of foods included, the differences in their nutritional value, and how to best include them in your diet.

levels.title: Acquaintance
levels.description: To get familiar with the group of fats and oils.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in the group of fats and oils?
Which of the following is included in the group of fats and oils?
Which of the following is included in the group of fats and oils?
Which of the following is included in the group of fats and oils?
Which of the following fats/oils is made from milk?
Which of the following fats/oils derives from red meat?
What is a plant oil?

answers.text: An oil derived from vegetables, seeds or legumes
A synthetic oil used for flavouring
The waste product of cooked vegetables/seeds

questions.question: What is margarine?

answers.text: A creamy sauce made from boiling milk
A solidified version of plant oils

questions.question: Which of the following pastes/spreads is produced by grinding nuts?
What is tahini?

answers.text: A sauce made from egg yolk
A paste made from ground sesame seeds
A solid version of safflower oil

questions.question: What is mayonnaise?

answers.text: A mixture of cream and tomato juice
A mixture of oil and egg yolks
A sauce from ground boiled eggs

questions.question: Which of the following fruits contains high amounts of lipids?

messages: This group includes ingredients used primarily for cooking, as well as sauces or spreads. They enable cooking foods and they give flavour and taste to dishes and meals. Their common nutrient is lipids.
Oils include any edible (=can be eaten) oil coming from plants (e.g. olive oil, sunflower oil, soybean oil).

Fats include the solid form of lipids, either coming from plants or animals :a)Plant sources: spreads like margarine and mayonnaise, all nuts and seeds (e.g., almonds, walnuts, peanuts, sesame) and their butters/pastes used in spreads (e.g., peanut butter, tahini). Also, olive oils and avocado.b)Animal sources: from red meat (e.g., pork lard, beef tallow), from milk (butter).

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar with the nutritional value of fats and oils.

questions.question: Which is the main macronutrient found in fats and oils?
Due to their high content in lipids, fats and oils also provide you with high amounts of:
Which of the following is true for animal-based fats, like butter and lard?

answers.text: They are a good source of fibres
They are rich in vitamin C
They contain high amounts of water

questions.question: Which of the following is true for plant oils?

answers.text: They are a good source of vitamin K

questions.question: Unlike other plant oils, palm oil and coconut oil contain?
Besides lipids, which other nutrient can be found in plant oils?
What are trans lipids:

answers.text: Lipids that are used raw in salads
Lipids that are solidified or cooked at high temperature
Lipids tgat are stored for longer than 1 month

questions.question: Which of the following foods might contain trans lipids?
Reading the labels of packaged foods can help you:

answers.text: Avoid foods that contain trans lipids

questions.question: Which of the following food ingredients is indicative of trans lipids?

messages: Fats and oils are primarily made up from lipids, the main role of which for the body is to store energy .
However, the quality of lipids differs significantly among the various fats/oils:
Animal fats, e.g. butter, cream and lard/tallow, contain mostly saturated lipids, which should be consumed in moderation for optimal health.

Plant fats , e.g. olive, nuts/seeds, plant oils and avocado, contain mostly unsaturated lipids, which are beneficial for the heart. An exception is palm and coconut oils, which are very rich in saturated lipids and should be avoided.
Most plant oils are rich in vitamin E which keeps your body’s cells health.
Among the various plant oils, olive oil, especially extra virgin olive oil, is considered one of the healthiest choices, as it is not processed and contains a wide range of healthy components!

But be careful! When some plant oils are turned into solid fats or cooked at very high heat, their structure changes, making them the most unhealthy lipids of all. They are called trans lipids and can be found in processed foods like pastries, salty snack and fast food.

levels.title: Recommended intake
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake of fats and oils in terms of quantity and quality.

questions.question: Which fats/oils should be consumed in moderation?

answers.text: Butter used as a spread for bread

questions.question: Most of your daily intake of fats/oils should come from:

answers.text: Butter and margarine used on bread
Plant oils used in cooking and salads

questions.question: What is a good way to avoid using too much fats/oils in cooking?

answers.text: Prefer steaming and boiling over frying
Use herbs and spices to make food tastier

questions.question: What is a good way to avoid using too much plant oil in salads?

answers.text: Consume vegetables a few times a week
Prefer vegetables which contain lots of fat

questions.question: Which of the following might contain trans lipids and should be avoided?

answers.text: Burger with fries from a fast-food restaurant

messages: Enjoy fats and oils in moderation!

Their lipid content makes fats and oils, as well as the products having these as ingredients, energy-dense foods, meaning that they provide a lot of energy (calories) for a given amount. That is why moderation in their quantity is recommended.

But their quality also matters! Remember: for optimal health, give a priority to healthy plant oils (e.g. olive oil, sunflower oil, safflower oil) and nuts/seeds over animal-based fats (e.g. lard/tallow, butter and cream), and try to avoid processed foods that might contain trans lipids as much as you can!

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with the best practices to handle and consume fats and oils.

questions.question: Which of the following is a healthy way to use plant oils?

answers.text: Add a lot to every meal
Use small amounts in cooking and salad dressings
Use them to deep-fry all foods
Use them only in raw and not cooked form

questions.question: Why is it important not to overheat plant oils?
When is the best time to add plant oils during cooking?

answers.text: At the beginning, on high heat
In the middle, on high heat

questions.question: Why is it important not to reuse plant oils multiple times?

answers.text: They get an unpleasant, pungent odour

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to add nuts and seeds in your diet?
Which is the healthiest form of nuts and seeds?
Which of the following is a good way to add nut butter in your diet?
Which of the following is a good way to add avocado in your diet?

answers.text: Use it mashed as a dip

questions.question: Where should plant oils be stored?
Where should butters and margarines be stored?

messages: High temperature can make plant oils lose important nutrients.Instead of deep-frying foods, it is best to use small amounts of plant oils at the end of cooking.
Don’t use the same oil over and over again, because heating it many times can make it unhealthy.
Exception: olive oil, especially extra virgin does not spoil in heat during cooking and can be used safely multiple times before discarded.
Nuts and seeds can be consumed as an easy-to-carry snack or added to yoghurt, breakfast cereals, home-made desserts and salads. For an even healthier option, choose raw and unsalted nuts!
Nut butters are full of healthy fats! You can use them in yoghurt, as a spread for bread or in home-made desserts (e.g. cookies or cereal bars) instead of butter or margarine.
Avocados are delicious! You can try them in salads or mashed as a dip or spread for toast.
Make sure to store fats and oils properly. Butter, margarine and cream must be stored in the fridge, whereas plant oils can be stored in room temperature but in a cool and dark place.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: To get familiar with the health effects of fats and oils.

questions.question: What is the main role of lipids in the human body?

answers.text: They help regulate the body's temperature
They are part of cell membranes

questions.question: Eating the proper amount of healthy fats and oils is important for:
Eating too many fats and oils might lead to:
Which lipids are the unhealthiest for yot heart?
For optimal health you should try to:?

category.text: prefer plant-based fats to animal-based ones

messages: Fats and oils are important for a healthy and strong body, but quality matters!

Lipids, the main nutrient found in fats and oils, are important for providing energy to the body, keeping the cells strong, helping your body use some vitamins and controlling your body’s temperature .

Keep in mind that moderation in the consumption of fats and oils is very important! Food industry uses them widely to make products that are very tasty, but they are also energy-dense and usually of low nutritional value. Consuming these products frequently may lead to excess weight gain in the long-term.
Try to avoid trans lipids, , because they are the unhealthiest lipids for the heart! A simple way to achieve this is to eat more fresh whole foods and less processed industrialised ones.

themes.title: Hydration (HYD) Quiz
themes.description: Increase your knowledge about hydration! Answer the questions and learn the importance of water and its superiority to other drinks for achieving adequate hydration and promoting your overall health .

levels.title: Acquaintance
levels.description: To get familiar with healthy means of hydration.

questions.question: Which of the following is a drink?
Which of the following is a drink?
Which of the following is a dairy-based drink?
What is kefir?

answers.text: A fruit juice with added sugar

questions.question: Which of the following drinks is made by blending fruits with milk or yoghurt?
What is sparkling/carbonated water?
What is flavoured water?

answers.text: Water with slices of fruits, herbs or vegetables

questions.question: Which of the following drink usually contains caffeine?
A herbal infusion is a drink made by:
Which of the following drinks usually contains sugar?
Which of the following is an alcoholic drink?

messages: Welcome to the world of hydration! To stay hydrated you can try a big variety of liquids:
Water, which is the most important drink. Flavour your water with fruits, herbs or vegetables or try sparkling/carbonated water, for more fun!
Fresh fruit juices, like orange juice, which are produced through squeezing or blending fresh fruits.
Milk, which is a dairy product, and fermented/cultured milk products, such as kefir
Herbal infusions, which are made by steeping and soaking herbs, spices, flowers or other plant materials in hot water (e.g. chamomile, sage, eucalyptus, peppermint).

Avoid drinks that contain caffeine (e.g. coffee, black tea, colas, energy drinks), added sugars (e.g. fruit nectars, soft drinks, energy drinks and sports drinks) or alcohol (beer, wine, spirits). They are not good means for hydration and maybe also harmful for your health.

levels.title: Nutritional value
levels.description: To get familiar iliarisation with the nutritional value of water and drinks.

questions.question: Which of the following nutrients is included in water?
Which of the following drinks contains vitamin C, which is important for your defence system?
Which of the following is true for fresh fruit juices compared to whole fruits?
Which of the following drinks contains the mineral calcium, which is important for strong bones and teeth?
Which of the following drinks contains beneficial germ?
Compared to traditional dairy-based drinks, most plant-based milk substitutes contain:
Which of the following drinks contains phytochemicals (special compounds that give plants flavour)?
Which of the following drinks contains sugar?
Which of the following drinks contains caffeine?
Which of the following drinks contains alcohol?

messages: To stay healthy, your body needs the right drinks!

Water is the best way to stay hydrated. You can easily understand its importance if you think that up to 60-70% of our body is actually water! It does not contain any calories or vitamins, but only small amounts of minerals, like calcium and magnesium.
Other healthy drinks contain various important nutrients:
Milk is rich in calcium, which is essential for strong bones and teeth.
Sour milk and kefir contain beneficial germs', which help the gut work properly.
Fresh fruit juices are packed with important vitamins (e.g. vitamin C); however, they have fewer dietary fibres compared to whole fruits.
But be careful! Not all drinks are nutritious.
Packaged fruit juices, soft drinks, sports drinks and energy drinks are ultra-processed and loaded with sugar and additives/preservatives, which have detrimental effects on the body.
Coffee, black tea and energy drinks also contain lots of caffeine, which can cause anxiety, irritability and sleep problems.
Alcohol damages your brain function, your behaviour and overall development, so you should abstain from drinking alcohol, even rarely.

levels.title: Recommended intake
levels.description: To get familiar with the recommended intake of water and drinks.

questions.question: Most of your daily fluids should come from:
The recommended intake of water depends on:
What is the recommended intake of water for a 5-year-old child?
What is the recommended intake of water for a 10-year-old child?
What is the recommended intake of water for a 15-year-old child?
In which of the following situations do you need to drink more fluids than usual?
Which of the following drinks should be completely avoided during childhood?

messages: The recommended daily consumption of water depends on age and sex. It is:
(6-7 glasses) for 4-8-year-old children,
(7-8 glasses) for 9-13-year-old girls or (8-9 glasses) for 9-13-year-old boys,
(8 glasses) for ≥14-year-old girls or (10 glasses) for ≥14-year-old boys.

Did you know that when the temperature is high (especially during the Summer), or if you are physically active, your body needs more fluids to replace the water lost through sweating and heavy breathing? Other situations in which you need more fluids are when you have high fever, diarrhoea and vomiting.

Remember: for optimal development and health try to completely avoid processed high-sugar drinks (e.g. fruit nectars, soft drinks and energy drinks), those that contain caffeine (e.g. coffee and black tea) and most of all drinks that conatin alcohol!

levels.title: Consumption practices
levels.description: To get familiar with best practices to stay hydrated.

questions.question: Which of the following can help you stay hydrated?

answers.text: Drink water when you feel thirsty
Drink some water with every meal and snack
Drink extra water when the weather is hot

questions.question: Which of the following can help you stay hydrated when out of home for several hours?

answers.text: Always carry a bottle of water with you
Only go out when it is cold

questions.question: Which of the following can help you stay hydrated at school?

answers.text: Have a bottle of water in your school bag

questions.question: To stay hydrated when doing physical activity you should drink water:

answers.text: Before, during and after the activity

questions.question: Which of the following is a good way to give water more flavour?
Which of the following is a good drink choice when you are out with friends?

answers.text: A smoothie made with fresh fruits and milk

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using a reusable water bottle instead of a single-use plastic one?

answers.text: It makes the water taste better
It is better for the environment

questions.question: How often should you clean your reusable water bottle?

messages: Drinking enough fluids every day is a simple way to take care of your health! Make sure to drink plenty of water at home, at school and when outside (e.g. when you go out for a walk with your family or friends and during extracurricular activities, including exercise). You can make water tastier by adding natural flavours, like slices of fresh fruits, vegetables or herbs.

Always carry a bottle of water with you so that you can stay hydrated even when out of home! Using a clean reusable bottle is the best choice, since it also helps the environment by reducing plastic use.
When out of home, choose drinks that hydrate you without added sugar or caffeine.

levels.title: Health effects
levels.description: To get familiar with the health effects of water and drinks, and the signs and consequences of dehydration.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about water in the body?

answers.text: It helps your body make energy and grow

questions.question: Drinking enough water each day benefits:
Drinking enough water each day is important for:
What happens if you do not replace the fluids you lose through sweat, breathing and urination?
When you are dehydrated, the colour of your urines may be:
When you are dehydrated, your mouth, lips and skin may be:
Which of the following is a symptom of dehydration?
Consumption of drinks with caffeine can:
A high consumption of sugar-sweetened drinks can increase the risk of:
Consumption of drinks with alcohol is detrimental for:

messages: Stay hydrated, stay healthy!

Drinking enough water is vital for your body. Water helps transport important substances to cells through blood, remove waste substances through urine, and supports many key functions of the body. It also keeps you focused and energetic, and regulates your body temperature.

Dehydration, which occurs when your body loses more fluids than it takes in, can present with signs and symptoms like thirstiness, dizziness, tiredeness, fatigue, dry mouth, non-elastic skin and bad breath. Did you know that you can check your hydration by observing the colour of your urine? Dark yellow urine is a sign of dehydration and that you should drink some water.Aim for light coloured urines, like a light- coloured chamomile tea.
Avoid drinks with caffeine, as they can cause overstimulation and disrupt your sleep.
Avoid sugar sweetened drinks, as a high consumption can increase the risk of tooth decay or obesity , in the long-term.
It is crucial to avoid alcohol consumption, as it is harmful to your liver, bones, mental and overall health.
